alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cannon Air Force Base, or 8 miles west of Clovis, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Farwell, Texico, Grady, Saint Vrain, Cannon Air Force Base, Ranchvale, Oasis State Park and Portair. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 370 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
